inn1.comm: and Irfan has removed Amla first ball at his home ground. A loose shot from Hashim. Irfan bowls in the zone first up. On a length, just short of driving length, and just outside off. Amla follows it, is done in by the angle, and gets a healthy edge. Kamran Akmal takes it in front of slip

bowled'im. Timber all over. Irfan is on fire. That's Garner bowling those yorkers with the left arm/ A perfect yorker first up. Swinging in, on the crease it lands and in front of off, and moves away slightly to beat the outside edge and knock the off stump over
oh a soft hat-trick ball. Full toss outside off, tentatively kept out by AB
signs of tennis-ball bounce. Short, wide, but AB has had to play this in front of square
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
short, and wide, and AB has cut it away really nicely. That bounce did get a bit big on him, but de rode it well and cut it between point and cover-point
short of a length, outside off, defended off the back foot
moves well across to defend a wide length ball
length ball, swinging back in, hits the inside half of the defensive bat
short of a length, just outside off, defended to short midwicket
moves well across to defend a length ball to short midwicket
looks to steer this behind square, but finds point. A maiden from Junaid to build up on Irfan's over
short of a length, outside off, left alone to angle away
short of a length, just outside off, runs off the face of the bat to third man for a single
that is nasty too. Short of a length, outside off, seams back in, jumps up uncomfortably too, hits him in the rib cage
forward to defend a short-of-a-length delivery
short of a length, outside off, left alone, climbs head high for Akmal
full now, in front of off, punched to mid-on
clipped away past midwicket for a couple
gets swing back in this time, but his AB high on the thigh
lovely shot. Short of a length, widish, angling away, and he rocks back to punch this between mid-off and cover
length ball, just outside off, defended off the back foot
thrashed down the ground. A half-volley outside off, and he is down on a knee to off-drive it between Junaid and mid-off
that beats him. Short of a length, he looks to bat it behind square, but is beaten by the extra bounce. Akmal doesn't gather it cleanly
short of a length. The first runs scored by someone not AB de Villiers. Worked away with the angle, past square leg
on a length, outside off, angles in, bounces into the thigh pad
moves across to work this length ball on the on side, but finds square leg
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single
full, 140ks, pitched outside leg, concedes a leg-bye
short of a length, 141ks, outside off, left alone to bounce way over Akmal's head who makes a good collection
short of a length, 138ks, defended in front of off
fuller, on off, defended off the front foot
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
full, middle and leg, pushed back to him
short of a length, pitches off, angles a little away, and is punched to short cover
dug in short, gets good bounce, and Smith gets a top edge on this pull. However, it falls safe in the midwicket region
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
short of a length, just outside off, rising towards the chest, defended nicely
nearly draws another. On a length, on off, 142ks, AB pushes tentatively, and is beaten by the angle and extra bounce
full, on off, dug out to the left of cover for a single
Smith has timed this hook sweetly. And he has got a big piece of this one. Short, about chest-shoulder high outside off, and Smith has sent it flying over the midwicket boundary
short of a length, middle and leg, hits him high on the bat
fuller, on off, watchfully played back to Junaid
on a length, middle and leg, straightens a little as opposed to angling away, hits the inside half of the bat
this one nips back in from short of a length to hit him on the thigh pad
more hint of swing back in, this is fuller and AB gets an inside edge past square leg. First runs off Junaid in 11 balls
length ball, middle and leg, holds its line, defended back
short of a length, just outside off, defended back to him
swinging in, full, defended off the front foot
on a length, outside off, worked into the on side for a single
wide, not too short, but he leans back to manufacture the length, and cuts it in front of square for three
walks right across to work a length ball off the hip to long leg
slower ball, outside off, on a length, defended to cover

bowled'im. Smith has moved too far across for his own good. I suspect this was a Younis Khan suggestion because they are all swarming him and he has a huge smile on his face. Junaid has noticed Smith has been moving too far across and he bowls a leg-side full toss that beats him and knocks the leg bail over
short of a length, outside off, left alone
on a length, on leg, he works it square on the on side
oo much drama with this ball. AB dabs this shortish delivery away to third man, and turns back for the second. Ajmal's throw is a little slow, and he makes it comfortably
clipped away off the pad to long leg for one

Pakistan are all over South Africa. This is superb bowling. This one swings back in from a length and just outside off. Behardien is already playing away from the body and tentatively. It comes back enough to take the inside edge through to Kamran who takes a diving catch down the leg side
full, on off, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, this doesn't turn away, and is punched to cover
flighted on off, defended back to him
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
nearly a return catch. AB dances down the wicket, the ball doesn't turn, the leading edge falls just short of Hafeez
short of a length, worked to leg
full, swinging in, nicely flicked to mid-on
short of a length, on off, pushed away with an open face, nicely timed past point
short of a length, on off, defended to leg
length ball, outside off, played to cover-point off the back foot
short of a length, angling away towards off, worked away into the leg side for a single
bouncer, but a touch too high, and called wide
length ball, holds its line outside off, left alone
gets an edge to a ball that doesn't turn, but steals a single to short third man
tossed up on off, defended to cover off the front foot
no turn this time, swept away to long leg for one
length ball, on off, turning in, pushed to long-on for one
full outside off, pushed to short cover
gets a single to long-off as Hafeez overpitches
length ball, on off, pushed past point for a single
on a length, outside off, defended with an open face to point
this length ball holds its line a bit in front of leg, and is bunted wide of mid-on for a single
pushes forward to a length ball, times it nicely to deep cover for one
length ball, pitches outside leg, worked away for an easy single
length ball, angling in towards off, defended back to him
short, gets a bit big on him, AB wants to ramp it, but the ball doesn't quite come on, and he ends up defending
short of a length, gets some extra bounce, but Miller plays with the bottom hand off, and gets a single to third man
short, into the body, chest-high, kept down. That's a slower short ball so AB is a bit early into this
plays the short-arm pull, gets a single to deep square
length ball, angling in, defended from the crease
on a length, outside off, angling in, defended solidly
down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball, defends to cover
turning into the pads, worked past midwicket for a single
what a drop, and it's the new man in, Imran Farhat. Clipped straight to him at short midwicket, but he just casually sticks one hand out after misjudging the dolly
defended to short midwicket
plays this with soft hands, towards Irfan at long leg, and steals the second. Picked their fielder
short of a length, on off, played yo mid-on
slower short ball, kicks off off a length, and beats AB's square cut with the extra bounce
short of a length, into the ribs, tucked away for a single
bouncer outside off, Miller stays away from its line
wide down the leg side. That's clearly the effort ball. Short of a length, at 142ks, collected overhead by Kamran
huge loopy tennis-balls bouncer. There is an aircraft going over the ground, this has almost hit it
wide length ball, defended to cover
runs off the inside half of the bat to long leg
steered away to third man for one
full, on off, 140ks, defended back to him
bowled from wide of the crease, short of a length, angling towards off, punched away past mid-on
AB defends a length ball well in front of his body
flashes at a shortish ball outside off, gets a thick edge for four fine of third man
another edge as Miller pushes at a length ball away from the body, gets a single to third man
drives a length ball to sweeper-cover
length ball, into the pads, nicely clipped away to deep midwicket for one
swept away superbly from outside off. Keeps it down, places it in front of square, gets four for it
short of a length, angling in, punched to midwicket
tossed up nicely, Miller is down the wicket to defend this back to him
short of a length, angling in, tucked away wide of short fine leg for another single
a shortish offbreak, defended to leg
short of a length, just outside off, defended to point
well bowled, holds its line after pitching short of a length and outside off. Beats the open face of Miller's bat
fuller, on off, defended well
punched to the left of deep point for a couple
wide of the crease, angling in, defended in front of leg
good bouncer, headed towards the throat at 146ks, he sways out of its line but it takes the best of him
paddled away to long leg for one

skidding non-turner and it makes for a very good leg-before appeal. The umpire says not out, and we are getting a review. Short of a length, middle and leg, skids through, hits him high on the pad, but Miller is deep in the crease. Has it straightened and skidded enough? Oh the line is good, but the predictor says it is bouncing over
flat offbreak outside off, pushed wide of point for one
another leg-before appeal as AB seems to be beaten on the reverse paddle. However, he he has got a chunky bottom edge for four to fine leg
defended to mid-on
flat offbreak, paddled away to long leg for one
full, on off, looks to drive, gets an inside edge. Slow off the surface
short of a length, angling in from wide of the stumps. Defended
dabbed away to third man for a single
bouncer, 144ks, on the stumps, Miller ducks under it
fuller now, on a length, driven on the up, but Riaz fields it well in his follow-through
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
defends a shortish delivery off the back foot
this offbreak kicks at him and hits the sweeping AB on the shoulder. A soft top edge is involved too
driven to long-on for one
shorter, outside off, punched to long-off for a single
short of a length, outside off, worked away for an easy single
short of a length, turning away from off, punched wide of point
short of a length, not too wide, cut in front of square. Doesn't quite come on
another cut in front of square. Can't find the gap
finally punches one left enough of point for a single
de Villiers reaches fifty with a drive to sweeper-cover
leading edge as Miller looks to flick this shortish delivery to leg, but it flies over point
full and wide, driven to sweeper-cover for another single
quickish start, 91ks, no turn, defended to leg
short of a length, on off, pushed to midwicket
shimmies down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
flighted on off, driven to long-off for a single
Miller's edgy existence lives on. This time he pushes at Afridi outside off, the legbreak doesn't turn as much as expected, and runs off the outside edge
flat and quickish, defended back to him
lapped away for a single
angling in, turned away to short fine, they don't take the single, but speak in Afrikaners, that they are going the next time
inside edge onto the pad, the ball rolls towards short third, and they steal a single
shortish, gets an easy single
another single to short fine leg
down the wicket to defend this offbreak
flighted outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single
short of a length, turning away slightly, defended to point
flighted on off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
quick, skiddy legbreak, draws a bottom edge as he looks to dab it
nice reverse-paddle. This is angling towards the pads, but he has reversed the shot, and placed it wide of the diving short third man
shimmies down the wicket to defend this to mid-off
flighted outside off, driven back to him
full, turning into the pads, driven to long-on
shortish, looks to cut it, gets a bottom edge as this is not short enough
down the wicket, gets a half-volley on the pads, works it wide of deep square for a couple
superb running. Bunted to the right of Junaid Khan at short fine leg, and they steal a second as Junaid takes time to reverse the ball to his throwing hand
defended into the on side for a single
appeal for lbw. Not given
length ball outside off, punched away on the up, past cover, pumps his fist as this takes him to fifty. Not the cleanest of innings, but can't question the fight or the value
defends a legbreak off the back foot
cut away for a single
looks to drive this on the off side, is slightly early into it, and uppishly plays it to point
slower through the air, gets some turn to beat AB's bat. Akmal fails to gather it
slow offbreak, on the pads, bunted away for a single
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one
tossed up on off, defended to cover
full offbreak, driven to long-off
short again, and pushed to long-on for another easy single
slower through the air, on off, defended back to him
quick, into the pads, worked away to deep square leg
tossed up, 94ks, holds its line on middle and leg, defended back to Afridi
another forward-defensive
slightly short of a length, he goes back to work it behind square on the off side, but can't beat point
punched away to deep cover this time
driven to long-on for one
swept away brutally. From just outside off, and through long leg and along the ground. Hundred runs for this stand
driven to long-on, and de Villiers just steals the second. In credible running putting Pakistan under incredible pressure
pushed to long-off for one. This is Miller's best ODI score
another leading edge as he looks to drive this widish ball to leg, but it falls short of mid-off
worked away off the pads for one
short, long hop, pulled away for a single
full, I suppose it is an offbreak, but Miller has driven this sweetly between mid-off and extra cover
slower legbreak, he goes back, covers the turn, bunts it to leg for one
stays back to defend
full, on off, pushed to long-off for one
short of a length, punched down to long-on for one

given lbw. Will he review it? Don't think it will do him any good. Miller is looking to paddle this and misses. The ball pitches leg, turns away towards off, and hits him in front of middle. Miller has reviewed it. It hits him on the roll and height seems the only thing that can save him. That is hitting the middle and leg stumps two-thirds of the way up
full, on off, defended back to him
slower through the air, hits the outside half of the bat, and de Villiers steals the single to short third man
short of a length, on off, pushed to short straight midwicket
full, turning in, pushed into the leg side for one
tossed up outside off, driven to sweeper-cover for one
short of a length, outside off, dabbed away to point for a single
driven to long-off for another single
short of a length, turning into the pads, worked away for a single
punched to deep cover for a single
turning into the pads, goes for a single to deep square leg
short, wide, lucky to get away with this one as McLaren finds extra cover
short again, this time worked away to fine leg for one
offbreak, turning in towards off, worked away to deep square
tossed up outside off, McLaren drives and is beaten
gets an outside edge to another slow offbreak. Lands safely before reaching point
beaten on the reverse sweep but this is headed down leg. McLaren wants to steal one to short fine, and is helped by a poor throw from short fine leg. AB just about makes it
short of a length, into the pads, punched to midwicket
cut away, lucky for Hafeez that he has point
gets away with another short ball. This time McLaren finds short third man
short of a length, into the pads, gets a single to deep midwicket
flat offbreak, AB takes a single to deep midwicket
sharp offbreak, turns past the bat, hits him high on the pad
full, driven with an open face, Afridi misfields at cover

Akmal takes his third difficult catch of the day. AB is not happy, but he has no review left. He looks to sweep this length-ball offbreak fine, seems to have been hit on the glove - not sure, though - and Akmal moves well with it and takes this on the second grab. A little, very small dot on the bottom edge too, when looking at the Hot Spot
defends one outside off
tossed up outside off, defended to cover
defended with an open face to short third man
on a length, outside off, defended to cover
flat again, and McLaren finally punishes it by dabbing it between point and short third man. Ajmal gives good chase, and keeps the ball in even though he his foot is over the rope, but only in air
driven to point
slow, high, defended back to him
non-turner, defended to leg
punched away to deep midwicket
short of a length, outside off, worked into the on side for a single
tossed up outside off, pushed to extra cover
length ball, angling into the pads, clipped away for a single

Huge laughs all around as Irfan takes a freakish catch. Lofted down to long-off, which is not a smart thing to do because one of the three boundary riders is stationed there. Irfan seems to have over-run this, but sticks his left mitt out nonchalantly and takes it overhead. It was almost like he was plucking a fruit from a low hanging tree
doosra, beats the outside edge and hits him high on the pad
defended outside off
short, on off, cut away to deep point
length ball, turning in, defended to leg
defended to midwicket
turning down the leg side, flicks the pad on the way
short of a length, he backs away to punch this to mid-off
tossed up on off, defended to leg
length ball, offbreak, from just outside off, defended to square cover
defended to cover as Ajmal tosses this up
slower through the air, Peterson defends well
full, on off, RP stays defensive
tossed up outside off, he bunts it to cover and takes a single
doosra. Rory knows nothing about this, but he will take every single of those four runs that result for the outside edge
short of a length, outside off, beaten as he looks to work this to leg
pushed into the leg side for a single
angled down the leg side for a wide
short legbreak, lucky to get away with it as it stays low
punched to deep cover for a single
turning into the pads, worked away for one
length ball, into the pads, worked away for an easy single
length ball, middle and leg, turned around to short fine leg
on a length, on off, defended
short of a length, middle and off, turns towards off, defended to mid-on
sharp offbreak, short third man does the fielding off the edge
slower through the air, tossed up on middle and leg, defended back to him
punched away to deep cover for a single
short of a length, turning into the pads, gets a single to short fine leg
darts one in on the pads, at 123ks, dug out for one
flighted on off, driven back to him
chips down the track to chip this to deep midwicket for one
googly, cramps him up, goes for a single wide of point
short, turning in, pulled away for a single
length ball, into the pads, pushed to long-on for one
angling in, on a length, defended, gets a single into the leg side
dug in short, pulled away to long leg
full toss, and he has hit it straight to cover
slower ball, angling in, in his arc, and RK loves this. Heaves it over midwicket for four
comes back with a yorker, on off, which is dug out back to him
full, just outside off, pushed to mid-off
short of a length, thumped away after clearing the front leg, but finds mid-off
short, angling in, RK clears the front leg again, and pulls this over midwicket. Valuable late boundaries coming from that bat
bowls this full and wide and beats the tailender who has been backing away
won;t need that bat again today. Irfan does him in with a low full toss. RK is backing away, leaving the stumps exposed and Irfan hits the base of the off
Steyn's strike rate: 400. He just pushes at a full and wide delivery, gets a nice little edge, and not only do they not have a slip, their third man is square too
paddled away from outside off for a single
Steyn's outside edge is being prolific today. This one comes off a doosra and goes past the slip for a couple
turning down the leg side, called a wide despite an exaggerated movement across from Steyn
topspinner, bounces into the rib cage, Steyn takes it back to the bowler using the bat as a hockey stick
extra bounce for Ajmal and Steyn defends
driven to long-on for one
lapped away to long leg for a single
full toss, hit back to Irfan. Just done in for pace
slogged away, but Younis Khan makes a diving save at midwicket to save three runs
length ball, driven to his left, Irfan sticks out law's long arm and fields
full, outside off, dug out to cover
yorker, middle and leg, dug out for a single to point
full toss, driven to long-off for one
and slips in a perfect yorker from round the stumps. Steyn does the heave-ho but misses by a week
superbly played. Junaid goes round the stumps and full and straight again, but Tsotsobe has puhsed forward at it, and times it amazingly and placed it between the non-striker and mid-of
yorker, on leg, dug out for a single, hands over the strike to RP

incredible shot. What do they think of themselves nowadays? He has reverse-paddle-swept a quick bowler. Kepler Wessels informs us he is a very good hockey player, which is what works here. Hockey hands send this full ball between short third and the keeper
this is more orthodox. Backs away, clears the front leg, and drives a full ball past point for four

seems like he is shaping up for the proper ramp this time, Khan bowls a wide length ball, Peterson changes the shot and swings, but is beaten outside off. Tsotsobe wants a bye, but is sent back and makes it back in time

inn2.comm: begins with a good outswinger, Farhat plays across the line, but it is headed down leg
on a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
another outswinger, Farhat plays across the line again, but once again that ball is headed down leg when it hits the pad
this time he bowls outside off, Farhat moves across to defend to cover
swinging down leg again, Farhat plays across the line again, but gets a leg-bye
outswinger, well outside off, left alone
length ball, outside off, defended to cover
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover

flicked away from off, with the angle, and they are appealing for obstructing the field. This is placed to the right of long leg, Farhat is adamant about the second, Hafeez is slow to turn, and he starts running with half an eye on the throw coming from the keeper to the bowler, and is hit by the throw. Hafeez has altered his course only slightly, but that is good enough to rule a batsman out under the new playing conditions. Hafeez is livid as he goes back; possibly he feels he didn't alter significantly or intentionally but he did alter the line of running if only slightly. First man to be given out obstructing the field after the new playing conditions were introduced
defended outside off
short of a length, bocked in front of off
short, wide, thumped away to the right of point
left alone
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length outside off, another leave
wide half-volley, he walks into the drive, and places it between cover-point and point. Top shot
clipped away off the pads for a single
angling away, left alone
full, middle and leg, pushed back to him

short, not too wide, Akmal throws his hands at it, gets a thick edge over slip. Smith leaps, gets a hand to it, but can't get a hold of it. That was a pretty safe shot the moment Akmal went hard at it
length ball, outside off, defended to point
clipped away off the pads, Kleinveldt makes a diving save running to his right from long leg
short of a length, outside off, pushed back to him
short of a length, on the stumps, defended back to him
short of a length, accurate, defended back
short, widish, Farhat goes for the cut, but is beaten
length ball, middle and leg, defended back to him
slower ball, too full, driven crisply, but straight to cover

Steyn nearly pulls off a blinder. Fast bowlers shouldn't be allowed to even attempt such catches. First of all this is a sharp bouncer, which does Farhat in for pace. It comes off the splice, lobbing to the left of Steyn, who dives full length, but can't hold on to it in all that momentum
short of a length, outside off, defended to end a maiden
wide down the leg side. Tried the bouncer but got it all wrong
full, on off, driven to mid-off

short, wide, rocketed straight to point. So Miller does pull off a near blinder. Remember Pakistan dropped a sitter from him, which cost them many runs in the first innings. This is like catching lightning. Absolutely smashed into the toes of pint where Miller goes down on a knee and plucks this without trouble. Akmal can't believe he has failed to either keep it down or hit it over the man because this ball was asking to be hit for four
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover
fuller, outside off, steered away to third man for a single
short of a length, wide, left alone
length ball, into the pads, flicked away to long leg
short of a length, on off, defended off the front foot
length ball, outside off, left alone
wider, Farhat shapes up for a big square hit, but pulls out late
short of a length, middle and leg, defended
on a length, shapes up as an outswinger, but goes with the angle after pitching. Defended well by Farhat
on a length, just outside off, driven with an open face, straight to point
short, wide, cut away over the slips to third man. Deliberately done by Younis Khan
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man
on a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
another forward-defensive from Younis. The required run rate has crossed 5 an over
cut away to third man this time
on a length, outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
on a length, angling across him, played back watchfully
slower ball. Farhat picks it late, but delays the flick suitably, and gets a single to midwicket
short of a length, widish, left alone
moves inside the line to flick a length ball, but can't beat McLaren at square leg
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, into the ribs, tucked away for a single
driven to cover-point
short of a length, on off, punched to extra cover
short of a length, on off, plays with soft hands, steals a single to mid-off
nicely played. Equally nicely fielded by Kleinveldt. This is angling in a bit much, and he nudges this fone. Not fine of Kleinveldt's dive at fine leg
slower ball, overpitched, driven to mid-on
looks for a big cover-drive, and is hit on the inside half of the bat as the ball angles back in
short of a length, outside off, Younis strides forward and leaves one alone
dropped. I would call it a half chance. Younis Khan cuts hard and deliberately behind square, but he doesn't get enough on it. Smith at slip goes up, gets both hands to it, but the ball pops out
wide down the leg side
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
bouncer, but too high, and is called wide
angling into the pads, flicked away for a single
stays back to cut a shortish delivery, can't beat cover-point

bowled'im. Played on. Stays a little low, I think. Younis Khan goes out to dab on a short-of-a-length delivery outside fof, the ball stays a little low, seams a little, and runs off the bat onto the stumps
on a length, outside off, defended to cover-point
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
short of a length, outside off, defended back to him
left alone outside off
length ball outside off, driven with an open face, to point
full, angling in to off, defended back. Another maiden
bouncer for Misbah first up. He ducks under it
defended back to him
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
low full toss, pushed wide of mid-off for a single
short of a length, angling in, clipped uppishly towards midwicket
angling in, on off, defended back to him
full, outside off, driven to the left of Peterson for a single
length ball, on off, defended off the back foot
defended off the back foot again
length ball, on off, worked to leg for one
driven to long-off for one
nudged into the leg side for a single
tucked away off the hip for a single
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover-point
short of a length, outside off, dabbed to the right of gully where Miller makes a good save
cut away, but straight to gully
extra bounce on this short ball, Misbah rises with it, and cuts uppishly between gully and point
short of a length, outside off, left alone
flat, outside leg, padded away for a couple to the left of fine leg
full outside off, driven to long-off
tries the reverse sweep, can't beat short third
full, outside off, pushed past cover
paddle sweep again, gets a single to fine leg
on a length, angling in, defended back to Peterson
short, wide, the extra bounce beats him
tucked away off the hip to long leg
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
full and wide, driven between mid-off and extra cover
short of a length, angling in, pulled away to deep midwicket
length ball, into the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for one
length ball, angling in, hits the top half of the defensive bat
nearly gets him. There is a man placed at short straight extra cover, and Misbah has hit this to that man on the half-volley. Early into the shot. It stopped at him
pushed to cover
pushes to wide of cover and runs
flicked to square leg
full and straight, pushed back to him
short of a length, punched powerfully, but straight to point
short of a length, outside off, seaming away. Left alone
left alone outside off again
short of a length, wide, defended to cover
moves across to defend a length ball to leg
runs this widish delivery down to third man for one
defended off the front foot
another forward-defensive
backs away to make room, RP stays steady, and Misbah ends up defending
full, middle and leg, flicked away wide of long-on
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
driven to long-off for one
short of a length, outside off, punched to cover
length ball outside off, driven to cover
slower ball, full, driven square, gets the single
wide down the leg side
short of a length, outside off, kicks a bit, beats the push
short, wide, cut away past point for four. Only the second boundary in the last 17.3 overs
angling too far down the leg side, clipped away to fine leg for one
taken from in front of and paddled away fine. off the bottom edge it goes
Misbah makes room and chips this to long-off for one
short of a length, not much room, he goes ahead with the cut, but can't beat point
full, on off, pushed back to him
sweeps, is beaten by the slowness of the ball

dropped. Farhat goes for the cut without room, gets an edge, but AB can't hang on. He goes for the second grab, but the ball falls faster than he reacts. That was a thick edge with a healthy deviation
short of a length, gets inside the line, works to leg
short of a lenght, pushed to the right of point, but can't beat Miller's dive
short, pulled to deep midwicket for one
short of a length, seaming in, drops and runs. They get a single with the soft shot, placed to the right of point
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
slower ball, shortish outside off, guided to third man for one
short and wide, cut to the right of deep pint, but Steyn makes a superb save with the big right foot stuck out
steered away to third man
slower ball, on off, pushed wide of point for a single
full, on off, defended straight to short cover
full, on the pads, clipped away for a single
pushed wide of point for a single
defended off the front foot
driven to sweeper-cover where the injured Steyn keeps them to two
nearly a repeat of Younis dismissal. Dabs away at one outside off, the ball angles in, stays a touch low, and takes the bottom edge, but this one avoids the stumps and goes for four
bouncer, Misbah ducks under it
short of a length, into the pads, pushed to deep square leg for one
bouncer, 134ks, pretty sharp, higher than shoulder, lower than the top of the head. He has to pull out of the hook because it has got too big on him
slower ball, on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
defended with an open face to pint as this pitches on a length and angles away
full, middle and leg, defended to cover
full outside off, driven to long-off
runs this cutter down to third man for one
top-edged pretty safely. A rare quicker delivery from Tsotsobe, close to 135ks. A bouncer, and Misbah pulls, and gets the top edge that goes over the wicketkeeper
short of a length, outside off, punched to sweeper-cover
length ball, on the pads, holds the line, hits the pad
Misbah goes boom. This is out of here. He backs away, makes massive amount of room, and takes a full ball from outside leg and sends it sailing over wide long-on
and now he gets a full toss that he sends crashing past the diving midwicket for four more

take that Misbah baggers. He has brought that required rate drastically. Once again, like Saleem Malik, he makes massive amount of room, and dries a half-volley straight over long-on. That's fifty too
short of a length, some spin, defended off the back foot
full, outside off, Farhat misses on the drive, and gets a bye
makes room, then goes back in front of stumps, defends this back to him
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on
paddled away from wide outside off for a single to long leg
backs away, then comes back across, drives this to long-on, and also steals an overthrow as South Africa begin to feel a bit of pressure now
once again he moves across from well outside leg and defends one back to RP
short of a length, outside off, angling in, defended to point
angling in too far, flicked away to the left of long leg for a couple
shouts for lbw as Farhat plays across the line of a full ball. Pitched in line but angling away to miss off
wide down the leg side now
slower ball, defended to point with an open face
looks to tuck this off the rib cage, but is early in turning the bat face, and the ball hits the back of the bat. However, this goes nowhere
lovely bouncer, at 138ks, aimed at the throat, angling away a bit, and Farhat fends and is lucky to have not edged it
Misbah backs away a long way and then drives a full ball to long-off
appeal for lbw but this seems to be turning too much. Pitches middle and leg, beats the inside edge with the turn, but seems headed down leg
paddled away to fine leg for one
Misbah is backing away again. He has pushed this to cover, and they are going for a quick single. The fielder swoops in, gets a one-handed pick-up and a flick even as he dives, but Farhat is in
paddled away from off, gets a single to fine leg
backs away again, gets a short delivery, which he cuts away for a single
short of a length, outside off, defended to cover-point
moves across the line to work this to leg for one
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
bouncer, looks to ramp it, but is beaten
short of a length, on the stumps, defended back
chips one over mid-on for a couple
makes room, defends to short third man, Farhat wants one but is sent back. Rightly
defended to mid-off
Misbah is swinging this match away. Once again he backs away massivley and loft s a full ball to wide long-on
once again he backs away, pushes one wide of point for one
on a length, on off, clipped to midwicket
paddled away to fine leg for one
wide down the leg side
short of a length, he gets inside the line and nudges it fine. Misbah calls him through for a second "on the throw"
slower ball, on the pads, gets a leg-bye
bouncer, seams in too, Misbah has to duck under it
full and wide, pushed to cover. "More dot balls," shouts AB from behind
dug in, rising towards the chest, Misbah fends, looks up and sees Farhat has charged halfway up the wicket. Farhat has to go back ad makes it in time
gets inside the line of a shortish delivery, gets a single
full, driven to long-off for one
reverse-sweeps, but find short third man
this is the orthodox sweep, but he has picked the gap superbly, going over square leg and to the right of fine leg
lapped away to fine leg for a single
gets inside the line of a shortish ball and bunts it for a single into the leg side
like Misbah, Farhat brings up his half-century with a stylish shot, driving a half-volley, nay drilling it, wide of cover
full, swinging in, clipped off the pad for a single
wide down the leg side
short of a length, runs this down to third man for a single
short of a length, on off, Misbah avoids it by swaying out of its line
full toss, pushed to mid-off
length ball, slightly slower, Misbah defends off the front foot
one full toss too many. Misbah had missed out earlier in the over, but he drives this between mid-off and extra cover, all along the ground
pulled away, mistimed, but clears midwicket
low full toss, runs off the thick outside edge, Steyn's throw from third man is wild, gives them an overthrow too
down the leg side, wide
short of a length, on the pads, defended
driven on the up, but straight to mid-off
length ball, on the pads, defended to midwicket
nicely nudged away off the pads, beats fine leg. Pakistan well on their way
short of a length, on off, defended with an open face to point
steered away to third man for a single
length ball, middle and leg, defended
sharp bouncer, 138ks, Farhat ducks under it
slower ball, short of a length, runs it down to third man for one
lovely bouncer, at 141ks, Misbah just about evades it with a half duck. Those crazy eyes are back. Pakistan's last hurdle is on the prowl
length ball, Farhat swipes across the line, manages enough bat on it to clear mid-off
wide down the leg side. A big wide too. Ninth wide in this innings
another hoick from Farhat, gets a single off the inside half of the bat
swinging in, defended off the back foot
length ball, angling in. Misbah has creamed this for four. How easily he has done it. Clipping it past midwicket, all along the ground
short of a length, wide, beats the attempted punch
low full toss, Misbah misses out on the flick, and AB does well with the dive on the deflection off the pad
length ball, outside off, played with an open face. Miller is sharp at point
slower ball, 108ks, on a lenght, driven on the up, but finds extra cover
looks to get inside the line and work it to leg, gets a leg-bye off the thigh pad
pushed wide of midwicket for a single
looks to ramp this short one, but hasn't picked the short one, and is beaten
short, into the ribs, Farhat looks to pull, gets a single off the glove
bouncer, doesn't get too high, Farhat tries to get out of the way and then tries to ramp it at the last moment. Is beaten
another wide, this time a slower ball goes too far outside off
Farhat looks to pull but is beaten by the slowness of this short ball
chipped off the toes, gets a single to deep square leg
full, angling into the pads, clipped away past the diving midwicket
short of a length, angling in, defended back to him
bouncer, down the leg side, another wide. No. 11 for South Africa
on a length, Misbah closes the bat face early, but the leading edge travels safely towards mid-off
fiery short delivery outside off, 138ks, beats the cut
that's smashed away. Short of a length, not too much room, punched away past the diving point. Also brings up 150 for the partnership
bouncer, sharp bouncer, 139ks, but down the leg side. Oh, the umpire hasn't called this a wide. Steyn has got away with one
looks to run this short delivery down to third man, but is beaten by the quickness. This is bowled at 141ks
another bouncer, 139ks, Farhat ducks. Steyn says, "Come on, come on." AB says, "You can also play a shot."
short of a length, on the pads, hits him on the thigh pad

Misbah misses century again. Oh the nearly man. This is the first time I have seen Misbah try to hit a six and fail. When he makes up his minds, he always clears the field. Backs away to try to launch him, but gets a top edge that seems to be clearing midwicket but Behardien does well to take this over his shoulder
driven to Peterson's right, and he dives to prevent runs
full, lapped away to fine leg for one
and Afridi goes boom. Makes room, steps down the wicket, and sends a full ball crashing past extra cover. Rocketed away
Boom Boom goes bust now. Gone second ball. Peterson bowls slower, shorter, Afridi rocks back to cut, but is done in by the slowness and gets an edge into AB's gloves
and Malik defends first ball. It is all tense now, and Kingsmead crowd is loving it
angling in, Farhat misses, but gets a leg-bye
he walks down the track and tries to run this shortish ball fine. Beaten by extra bounce
short, wide, stays low, Malik finds point with the cut
that;s a bouncer, called one for the over as Malik ducks under it. Looked a wide to me
short of a length, cramps him up, Farhat calls him for a superb single: the ball has not even left the pitch
Farhat takes the risks and it pays off. Backs away from the stumps, and plays a two-handed forehand to a shortish ball, over mid-off
Phangiso, substitute for Smith, goes flying to his left at short cover to save four certain runs. He is doppelgÃ¤nger of the Mask. The Mask would have been proud of this save
length ball, on the pads, helped away for a single
slower ball, it also follows Farhat who is backing away. Farhat manages a single somehow, to cover
Malik follows a wide lenght ball and gets the perfect edge. thick enough to beat the diving keeper, thin enough to beat third man. There was a slip when Malik just came in; none now
another wide. Short of a length, angling across, too far out of Malik's reach
full, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on and steals a single
Amla saves three. South Africa hanging in. their fielding has kept them alive. This is a juicy half-volley, which Farhat has absolutely smoked, but Amla makes a diving save at mid-off
nicely tucked away off the hip, to the right of Amla at long leg, gets a couple
short of a length, angling in, tucks him up. Defended to leg
another wide. That's No. 13. This is down leg side, and he better be thankful this is wide because Farhat is looking to pull this into the stands. Any touch on this would have been serious runs
runs this slower ball down to third man for one
short, wide, Malik into the act. Cuts this in front of point and square of square-cover. What calm he brings to chases
bouncer, middle and leg, Malik ducks under it
another bouncer, quite slippery, 135ks, Malik is beaten on the pull
and he beats AB with the pace first up as he looks to run this down to third man. Bowled at 138ks. Steyn is wondering if they should review this, but there is no edge on this
Farhat has hit Steyn back over his head for six. Read that again. Rub your eyes. Read that again. Clears the front leg, gets it in the slot, and swats this back
short, rising towards his throat, fended well
cut away, can;t beat cover-point, but takes the single
short, into the ribs, tucked away nicely for a single
looks to ramp a bouncer, but is beaten by the 144k pace of it
short, Malik makes rooms, but this follows him, and the cut finds cover-point
shows him the backing-away motion, then moves across to get inside the line, and gets a single to long leg
bouncer, at the head, he pulls and is beaten
big appeal for catch on the hook. Not only is this not-out, this is also a big wide for height. Umpires have been pressured enough here by the appeal so as to get away with that wide call
Farhat gives himself room, Kleinveldt follows him with a short one, beats him
pulled away to long leg for a single
driven on the up, the diving cover gets a hand to it, keeps them down to one
quick length ball, no room, Malik defends, but the ball has hardly left the pitch by the time Farhat completes the single
bouncer, gets inside the line to try to work it fine, but is beaten by the pace

what an unbelievable catch. Behardien keeps South Africa alive. Short again, Farhat is in a tangle, somehow gets enough bat to clear cover-point. So it seems. Behardien covers an insane amount of ground and takes this over his shoulder
short into the body, Malik tucks it away to long leg for one
bouncer, but wide outside off. Steyn is negotiated

South African fielders are turning this game around on its head. This is sensational. Malik drops this towards point and runs, but Miller swoops in like a cheetah from point, makes a one-handed pick-up, and underarm-flicks it onto the only stump visible when he is in the air himself. Miller slides into Riaz's bat but what a wicket he has got South Africa
oh boy, what a shot to be played first ball. Ajmal has kiled this chase off. Poor bowling from Tsotsobe. Short, wide, and he Ajmal square-cuts it wide of point
full, on the pads, pushed to midwicket for a single. Malik looks back to see Phangiso is going at his end, and he has to hare through
all over. Malik finishes this off. Moves across, Tsotsobe follows him wide on off, and he then backs away late to create the room and cuts it through point for four
